usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script manipulates 3D entities using Element, Beam, and Sip classes. Uses PrEntity to select ElementWall objects in the model. Performs 3D operations like addToolStatic and dbSplit. No ShopDrawing (sd_*) or Viewport logic present.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Model Space with existing Wall Elements containing Beams and SIPs

scriptPurpose.summary: Automatically adjusts the framing around wall openings in SIP (Structural Insulated Panel) construction by resizing studs to match panel thickness and splitting top and bottom plates to accommodate the thicker jambs.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Used after generating SIP walls with openings to ensure the trimmer and king studs are cut to the full thickness of the insulation panel and that the plates are split correctly to fit the modified studs, preventing design errors in high-performance building envelopes.

outputEntities.description: Modifies the dimension (width/depth) of trimmer and king studs perpendicular to the wall to match the full thickness of the SIP element (dFullThickness).
outputEntities.appliedTo: Trimmer Studs, Panel King Studs, Panel Trimmer Studs found on the left and right sides of wall openings.

outputEntities.description: Applies static cuts to the vertical studs at the intersection points with top and bottom plates.
outputEntities.appliedTo: Trimmer Studs and King Studs adjacent to openings.

outputEntities.description: Splits the top and bottom plates at the specific locations where the widened vertical studs intersect them, allowing the plate segments to fit correctly around the thicker studs.
outputEntities.appliedTo: SF Bottom Plate, Panel Bottom Plate, SF Top Plate, Panel Top Plate intersecting the adjusted stud banks.

workflowDiagram: Script initialization with sequence number -120 and unit set to mm.
Check if script is in Insertion Mode (_bOnInsert).
If Inserting: Check if insertCycleCount > 1.
If cycle count > 1: Erase current instance and terminate (prevent duplicate executions).
If cycle count <= 1: Prompt user to 'Select one or More Elements' (ElementWall) using PrEntity.
If User cancels selection: Exit script.
If User confirms selection: Store selected Elements in _Element, return and wait for construction events.
Wait for Database creation or Element Construction event (_bOnDbCreated || _bOnInsert || _bOnElementConstructed).
Loop through each selected Element in _Element.
Validate Element: Check if Element is valid.
Extract Element geometry: Coordinate System (CS), Vectors (vx, vy, vz), Origin.
Retrieve all Openings, Beams, and SIPs from the Element.
Validate Element content: Skip if Beams or SIPs are empty.
Calculate dFullThickness based on the first SIP's height (dH).
Initialize arrays for Trimmer/King Studs, Bottom Plates, and Top Plates.
Filter Beams: Categorize into Trimmer/King Studs, Bottom Plates, and Top Plates based on type keywords.
Sort Trimmer/King Studs perpendicular to the wall X-axis.
Loop through each Opening in the Element.
Calculate Opening Center Point and project it onto the mid-plane of the wall.
Identify Left Stud Bank: Cast half-line from center towards -vx to find intersecting studs.
Group Left Studs: Aggregate adjacent studs (distance check < U(0.1)) into a bank.
Process Left Stud Bank: Ensure bank has > 1 stud (indicating a jamb configuration).
Loop through Left Studs (except the last in the bank) to resize and cut.
Resize Stud: Set dimension along Z-axis (vz) to dFullThickness (match SIP thickness).
Check Top Plate Intersection: Use T-Connection filter to find intersecting top plates.
If Top Plate intersects: Calculate split points, record range, and apply static Cut to the stud at plate edge.
Check Bottom Plate Intersection: Use T-Connection filter to find intersecting bottom plates.
If Bottom Plate intersects: Calculate split points, record range, and apply static Cut to the stud at plate edge.
Split Left Top Plate: If intersections occurred, find plate segment, split between recorded points, and update array.
Split Left Bottom Plate: If intersections occurred, find plate segment, split between recorded points, and update array.
Identify Right Stud Bank: Cast half-line from center towards +vx to find intersecting studs.
Group Right Studs: Aggregate adjacent studs into a bank.
Process Right Stud Bank: Ensure bank has > 1 stud.
Loop through Right Studs (except the last) to resize and cut (similar to left side logic).
Resize Right Studs to dFullThickness.
Handle Right Top/Bottom intersections and apply static Cuts.
Split Right Top/Bottom plates at calculated ranges (handling directionality correctly).
Finish processing all Elements.
Check if script modified anything (nErase flag) or if Element was constructed.
If true: Erase the TSL instance (script is a one-shot generator/adjuster).

path1.name: Bank Size <= 1
steps: Skip processing (Assumes standard opening or different configuration requiring >1 stud for jamb thickening)

validationRules.errorMessage: Implicit cancellation via PrEntity return status.
validationRules.recovery: User must select ElementWall objects and restart command.
Ensure generated wall has structural framing and panels assigned.

validationRules.check: Stud bank contains more than one stud.
validationRules.errorMessage: None (Script assumes specific framing topology with double/multiple studs at openings).
validationRules.recovery: Generate wall with trimmer/king stud configurations that include multiple studs on the jamb.

postInsertionActions.how: Automatic upon completion of geometry processing (_bOnElementConstructed).
postInsertionActions.effect: The TSL instance is removed from the model, leaving only the modified beams and split plates. No further edits possible via this instance.

data.markdown:
# hsb_SIP-OpeningFrameAdjustment

## Overview
This script automates the adjustment of wall framing around openings for SIP (Structural Insulated Panel) construction. It resizes trimmer and king studs to match the full panel thickness and splits top and bottom plates to accommodate the wider framing, ensuring a proper fit for high-performance building envelopes.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Script must be run on 3D wall elements. |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Script modifies the 3D model, not drawing views. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: ElementWall entities containing structural Beams and SIP panels.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (However, walls must contain openings with framing to have a visible effect).
- **Required Settings**: None.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `hsb_SIP-OpeningFrameAdjustment.mcr` from the file browser.

### Step 2: Select Elements
```
Command Line: Select one or More Elements
Action: Click on the ElementWall entities in the model that you wish to process. Press Enter to confirm selection.
```

### Step 3: Completion
The script will automatically process the selected elements, resize the studs, split the plates, and then delete itself from the model.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| N/A | N/A | N/A | This script has no user-configurable properties. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| N/A | No custom context menu options are provided. |

## Settings Files
- **Filename**: None
- **Location**: N/A
- **Purpose**: N/A

## Tips
- **Double Stud Requirement**: The script specifically looks for "stud banks" (groups of studs) on the left and right sides of openings. It only processes openings where there is more than one stud (e.g., a King stud and a Trimmer stud). Single studs at openings will be ignored.
- **Execution Order**: Run this script after generating the SIP walls but before creating final shop drawings or exports.
- **Self-Cleaning**: This is a "one-shot" script. It will automatically erase its own instance from the drawing immediately after modifying the wall geometry.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did my studs not resize?**
  - **A:** The script logic requires at least two studs adjacent to each other at the opening jamb (a bank size > 1). If you only have a single trimmer or king stud, the script will skip that opening to avoid errors.
- **Q: How does the script know what thickness to use?**
  - **A:** It calculates the required thickness based on the height (`dH`) of the first SIP panel found within the selected Element.
- **Q: Can I undo the changes?**
  - **A:** Yes, you can use the standard AutoCAD `UNDO` command to revert the geometry changes, though you will need to re-insert the script to run it again.
